page.title: 11BENTHAM POTTERY
page.content: There are two potteries in Bentham. We visited Low Bentham Pottery which is owned by Kathy Cartledge. In the gallery all the pots are on display. One of the shelves has "seconds" on it. Behind the gallery is the workshop where all the pots are made. We watched Mrs Cartledge throw a pot on the wheel. We watched her helper fettle pots. Fettling is cleaning pots and tidying them up. Mrs Cartledge uses stoneware clay. The pots are in the kiln from 7.00am to 5.00pm. When a pot has dried out it is put into the kiln to be biscuit fired, after that it is dipped in glaze and then put into the kiln again to be gloss fired. It comes out all shiny. The pots are sold in the gallery and in shops all over Lancashire, Yorkshire and Cumbria.
